pullRequest.title: Batch Operate Rollup table in Doris #2671

commit.message: Batch Operate Rollup table in Doris #2671

nodes.bodyText: How about cancel rollup with rollup name? not job id?
max_running_rollup_job_num_per_table ?
What's meaning of ops?
After java8. prefer to Optional
could replace by CollectionUtils.isNotEmpty

This comment confuse me.
sort rollup index -> successfully create rollup index ?

For simple. I think we needn't introduce the Dependency concept. We could check the
alter statement and require the from index must exist firstly, and then, we needn't consider the rollup job dependency.
only use one write lock is enough.
Would better add a comment to explain why concurrent rollup job for one table could work.
Please update the user doc firstly.
I think there is no concurrent issue. you could directly use alterJobsV2.
why replay here？
change return type to bool?

commit.message:
1 update doc
2 persist batch rollup job in one atomic operator
3 init rollup job index when running

1 update doc
2 persist batch rollup job in one atomic operator
3 init rollup job index when running

nodes.bodyText: Why add a INIT state? which is necessary？ what's the difference from PENDING state?

r3(event_day) from r1

nodes.bodyText: put the after the OP_MODIFY_DISTRIBUTION_TYPE to make the opCode ordered, even if OP_BATCH_ALTER_JOB_V2 is the same catalog of ALTER JOB. Otherwise, the following developer may use wrong code.
And add comment to explain why there should be only one job in the schemaChangeJobV2List
wrap the comment, its too long in one line

Add a comment here to explain why after replaying the pending job,
the state is still PENDING:
to make sure that this job will run runPendingJob() again to create the rollup replicas

I think this comment can be removed when you keep the job's state
in PENDING after calling replayPending(). Am I right?

"batch drop rollup" operation should still be atomic when writing meta log.
So you need to modify the processDropRollup():


First, traverse all drop clauses to validate them, such as whether to drop the base index, does the rollup index need to be dropped exist.


Do the real drop operation. And all-or-non rollups should be dropped.


Write a edit log named BatchDropRollupOperationLog to persist the meta.
Can it be an assertion? I found there is no way to add an already-done job here.
Add comment to explain return value's meaning.

getUnfinishedAlterJobV2ByJobId() may return null if job does not exist, so rollupJobV2List may contains null. You didn't check it when using it after.
Another problem is, batch cancel operation can be partial success in your implementation.
Although I advocate all operations to avoid partial success. But for cancel operation, this change may be slightly more complicated. A two-phase protocal may be needed to achieve this.
So if you keep the current implementation. The first requirement is to allow the user to specify a non-existing job id to cancel. Second, the document needs to indicate that there may be partial success here, and the user needs to retry multiple times until a successful message is returned.
